poem:
### The Whispers of Iron

Beneath the desert sun,  
the whispers grow louder—  
a distant thunder,  
an eagle's shadow  
stretched across sands.

In the fragile dance  
of swaying oases,  
no shouts of power  
break the silence,  
only the toll of unseen clocks  
ticking towards  
an unknown hour.
